name: 范書愷
objective:
This is a first course in designing experiments and analyzing data. The course deals with the types of experiments that are frequently conducted in industrial settings. The goal is for you to learn how to plan, design, and conduct experiments efficiently and effectively, and learn how to analyze the resulting data to obtain objective conclusions. Both design and analysis issues are discussed. 

本課程為本研究所第一門教授設計實驗並分析後續實驗數據的課程，其目的在於教授學生如何有效地、有效率地規劃、設計、並執行實驗。
schedule:
1.　　Fundamentals of engineering statistics & principles of experimentation
2.　　Simple comparative experiments; one-way ANOVA & CRD (completely randomized design)
3.　　RCBD (randomized complete block design) & Latin square designs
4.　　Factorial design & 2k factorial design
5.　　Blocking & confounding in 2k factorial design
6.　　2-level fractional factorial design & its resolution; 3-level (fractional) factorial designs
7.　　Fitting regression model: Estimation, Diagnostics and Prediction
8.　　Response surface methodology & process optimization (including EVOP & Simplex EVOP)
9.　　Random effects model
10.　　Nested & split-plot designs
11.　　Box-Cox transformation & GLM
12.　　Unbalanced design (missing data) & covariance analysis of factorial design 
13.　　Computer-generated (optimal) design theory
14.　　New materials from the recent literature (JQT, Technometrics, among others)
Topics 12-14 are restricted by time available.

Prerequisite concepts

• Random variables (definition, Functions of random variables, Expectation and Variance operators)
• Random sampling
• Properties of point estimators (bias, variance, mean square error)
• Maximum likelihood estimation
• Sampling distributions (distributions that originate from sampling):
– Normal
– Student’s t
– Chi-square
– F
(definitions of each of the above, relations between them).
• Use of sampling distributions to build confidence interval estimators and test hypotheses for
means and variances of normal populations and differences between means and variances from two different populations.
• Central limit theorem
materials:
Montgomery, D. C. (2013), Design and Analysis of Experiments, 8th Ed., Wiley. Additional materials will be covered from other texts and/or from recent literature.  We will make use of the SAS, Minitab & Design Expert statistical package (the use of other computer software should be approved by teaching assistant in advance).
